text: Hello, finally if you disable option into HubSpot settings, "receive data from non-HubSpot forms" all good
wordpress forms with Gravity form are going well to HubSpot. Also all others HubSpot forms.
You could lock down access to your private app based upon where the request is coming in from, I would think.

using javascript or jquery you could do that, it takes a bit of time to get that set up. Often times people will do this with their own custom html/css/js form or a react form, then push the form data to the forms api
Hi Chad, there isn't a way for private apps to manage oauth access tokens. Just to clarify, this `private app token` is not the HubSpot private app access token, but an API key for your endpoints?
